Wow -Sounds like a really interesting read! And great review!

What I'm cur=
ious about with this book and the film Gohatto is why the Shinsengumi is 
b=
eing used to explore the theme of nanshoku (male-male love)? Is there docum=
ented 
historical reasons for this? If not, why Shinsengumi and not - say -=
 the 47 Ronin or 
Miyamoto Musashi? Just curious :-).. I do plan on picking=
 the book up so thanks so much 
for the FYI and the great post below!


---=
 In SHQ_Spy_Division@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@...> wr=
ote:
>
> [This post contains a brief introduction and
> review for a yaoi n=
ovel.  The post does not 
> actually contain yaoi and is rated-G.]
> 
> Dea=
r Friends,
> 
> I've read the early drafts of GOJOU HAJIME, a 
> work of ya=
oi so here is my review of the work...
> 
> Whereas well known films like T=
ABOO/GOHATTO move
> at a meditative pace and leaves key narrative themes
> =
up to viewer interpretation GOJOU HAJIME is the exact 
> opposite.  The nov=
el's pace is very even and balances out
> the chapters by switching between=
 the various pairings and
> leaves *nothing* to the imagination.
> 
> What =
struck me the most about GH is the tone or voice of the
> writing is very y=
outhful and matches the age range of the 
> main characters.  One will noti=
ce how effective this "voice" is
> in regards to the Hajime and Okita pairi=
ng.  The humorous interaction
> between the more mature pairing, Hijikata a=
nd Kondou is absolutely
> exciting and contrasts with the dominance and sub=
mission psychology in
> the Toudou and Serizawa couple.
> 
> The homosexual=
ity in the work deviates for a refreshing mxf romance
> I'll not reveal her=
e.
> 
> My only complaint is I wanted more action. I hope that the female l=
ead
> becomes more developed in the sequel.
> 
> GOJOU HAJIME is a relaxing=
 read where the plot is based on emotional
> and physical reaction between =
characters.  
> 
> [BLURB]
> During Japan's 1800's the samurai
> became dis=
satisfied with the shogun
> for opening their isolated nation to
> the West=
ern Barbarians. Many
> rebelled and plotted to overthrow
> the shogun and r=
estore their emperor
> to a seat of power. The shogun
> arranged a band of =
expert swordsmen
> to manage the revolution. Given the
> name, Shinsengumi =
(Newly Selected
> Corps), the brave men were
> commissioned to eliminate th=
e unruly
> samurai and ronin, sanctioned to kill.
> The men lived for the m=
oment, for their
> lives could end in an instant. Under
> stressful circums=
tances some of the
> men turned to one another for comfort,
> but how far d=
id they venture from there
> into the realm of taboo?

rical, gay, yaoi,
